Entries.default: What you initially take for yet another frozen corpse, appears, on closer inspection, to be a heavily armored figure encrusted in a jagged layer of cloudy bluish ice.
[Examine the outstretched hand.]
[Examine the armor.]
[Leave it be.]

The angle of the joints indicate that the warrior once gripped something tightly - something since removed. Deep scratches in the wrists suggest that someone clawed at the figure long after it froze over, perhaps to remove the absent object.
Two of the fingers have been broken from the hand. Based on the hard, sharp edges of what's left, it seems this occurred after the figure froze over.

Layered chain and plate - highly adaptable to varying circumstances - often proves popular with those travelers who can afford it. Members of military or religious orders in particular favor wearing armor like this kind with their uniforms or vestments. 

The set before you appears to be of a style not commonly crafted in the past two centuries.
You painstakingly pick at the many straps and buckles, slowly unfastening the rime-crusted armor from its pale elf bearer.
[Remove the armor.]
[Remove the helmet.]
The armor's intricate straps, weaved chain, and interlocking plates have frozen solid. Removing the armor without damaging the warrior within may prove difficult - if not impossible.
[Use a prybar to carefully free the armor.]
[Pull the armor free.]

As delicately as you can, you take a chisel to the straps and the edges of the armor, chipping away the ice holding it in place. 

You loosen the gear, but it remains frozen in place.
The rest of the armor proves no more difficult to claim, and soon you've collected the whole of it, leaving the frozen elf standing in her tattered robes.

You grasp the breastplate and pull. When it doesn't give, you set your feet and heave as hard as you can. With a crack that echoes off the walls, the breastplate comes free... along with the elf's torso. 

The halved elf slips from your grip, striking the ground, where it shatters into ragged chunks.
The breastplate gives not at all, remaining firmly affixed to the elf who wears it.
You easily pull the armor from the remains.
The rest of the armor proves no more difficult to claim, and soon you've collected the whole of it, leaving the frozen elf standing in her tattered robes.
Two of the fingers have been broken from the hand. Based on the hard, sharp edges of what's left, it seems this occurred after the figure froze over.

The angle of the joints indicate that the warrior once gripped something tightly - something since removed. Deep scratches in the wrists suggest that someone clawed at the figure long after it froze over, perhaps to remove the absent object.

The figure stands straight, shoulders a bit forward, as if against a strong wind. The posture bespeaks a deep resolve in the face of terrifying force.

The upraised hand seems to be warding against some threat.

The figure stands straight, shoulders a bit forward, as if against a strong wind. The posture bespeaks a deep resolve in the face of terrifying force.

The upraised hand seems to be warding against some threat.
Two of the fingers have been broken from the hand. Based on the hard, sharp edges of what's left, it seems this occurred after the figure froze over.
Two of the fingers have been broken from the hand. Based on the hard, sharp edges of what's left, it seems this occurred after the figure froze over.

The breastplate and chain worn by this figure seem significantly more intricate than anything else you've seen since arriving at Harbingers' Watch. Padding and heavy cloth complete the panoply, probably as protection against the cold.

The breastplate and chain worn by this figure seem significantly more intricate than anything else you've seen since arriving at Harbingers' Watch. Padding and heavy cloth complete the panoply, probably as protection against the cold.

The breastplate and chain worn by this figure seem significantly more intricate than anything else you've seen since arriving at Harbingers' Watch. Padding and heavy cloth complete the panoply, probably as protection against the cold.

The breastplate and chain worn by this figure seem significantly more intricate than anything else you've seen since arriving at Harbingers' Watch. Padding and heavy cloth complete the panoply, probably as protection against the cold.
Barely visible through the ice you can make out etchings suggestive of the imagery of Rymrgand - snowflakes, skulls, and, of course, the horned face of the aurochs.

Layered chain and plate - highly adaptable to varying circumstances - often proves popular with those travelers who can afford it. Members of military or religious orders in particular favor wearing armor like this kind with their uniforms or vestments. 

The set before you appears to be of a style not commonly crafted in the past two centuries.
Barely visible through the ice you can make out etchings suggestive of the imagery of Rymrgand - snowflakes, skulls, and, of course, the horned face of the aurochs.
The helmet does not appear to be as solidly frozen to the figure as the rest of the armor. A few minutes spent wiggling and tugging at it frees the helm.
You lift it to reveal an elven woman with bluish white skin and darker blue hair. Her coloration and the heavy epicanthic folds hooding her eyes mark her as Glamfellen.
[Melt the ice with magic.]
[Use a hammer and chisel to loosen the armor from the figure.]
[Search for the presence of spirits.]
You open your soul to the presence of other spirits.
While a few strands of weak soul energy cling to the frozen figure, you sense no soul present within or near the body.
[Unfasten the straps.]
[Specified 2] painstakingly picks at the many straps and buckles, slowly unfastening the rime-crusted armor from its pale elf bearer.
Despite hours of careful effort, the armor's straps and buckles do not yield to the clumsy fingers pawing at them.
With some effort, you free the loosened breastplate from the remains.
With some effort, [Specified 3] removes the breastplate from the remains.
[Reconsider your options...]
You reexamine the frozen figure.
You slide the prybar between the metal and the remains, gingerly shifting it back and forth, cracking the ice. A final sharp crack sends the frosted armor clanging to the floor.
You call forth a gout of burning essence.
[Specified 4] summons forth a blast of flame.

Steam billows outward as the ice melts away from the corpse.

After a moment, flickering orange light and cracking sounds emerge from within the cloud as the corpse's clothes ignite...

The charred remains sag to the floor, rapidly cooling as the magical flame runs its course.

You gather the miraculously unharmed armor from the remains.
Even with the straps unfastened, however, the armor remains frozen in place.

Grasping the breastplate, [Specified 3] strains against the figure. With a crack that echoes off the walls, your compatriot tears the breastplate free... along with the elf's torso.

[Specified 3] drops the halved elf in surprise. The body strikes the ground and shatters into ragged chunks.
[Speak a prayer for the elf's soul.]
"Want to put that lamp of yours to use, Xoti?"

She bites her lip. "'Less I'm mistaken, she's been frozen here an awful long time. But if there's anything left to reap, I'll reap it."

She waves her lantern, but no soul heeds her call.
You take a few minutes to consign the deceased to the Wheel.
"If that elf's soul is still around to see what you did to her body, I do not believe a prayer will make her feel any better."
"I hope that was an apology, captain." Tekēhu frowns down at the shards of frozen remains blanketing the floor.
You leave the remains behind.
The warrior's upraised hand seems to be reaching out towards something, the fingers splayed wide and grasping.
You take a few minutes to consign the deceased to the Wheel.
